column4: I have an ubuntu desktop with onboard graphics, and a video card with dual output. I know how to set up dual monitors on the card, but was wondering, if I could possibly add a third monitor to the onboard video, to expand my desktop further, is this possible or do I need another video card?
hey man, I've had 5 monitors on a single pc using 5 old pci video cards.  You can combine agp/pci cards
right but i'm asking if i can combine onboard with pcie
it was on FreeBSD, but it usd X like ubuntu, so Ill bet it's not too hard
